text: Jenny LeClue is an adventure game developed and published by Mografi. It was released for iOS, Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux in September 2019, and will be released for PlayStation 4 at a later date. The game was released for Nintendo Switch on August 25, 2020. ==Gameplay== The choices that players makes throughout the game has an impact. The game contains point-and-click elements, and features a hand-drawn art style. Players are able to interact with most items in the game. During dialogue sections, players can observe the person talking to spot clues as to whether they are lying. Locations that players explore include mines, graveyards, mountains, police stations, and libraries. ==Plot== A young detective named Jenny LeClue must clear her mother of murder. A fictional author acts as the game's narrator. ==Development== The game had a successful crowdfunding campaign. With a goal of $65,000, it reached $105,797 by August 2014. It was released for iOS, Microsoft Windows, macOS, and Linux on September 19, 2019, it was released for Nintendo Switch on August 25, 2020 and will be released for PlayStation 4 later in 2020. For the iOS version, it was released on the Apple Arcade service. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2019 video games Category:Apple Arcade games Category:Crowdfunded video games Category:Detective video games Category:Indie video games Category:IOS games Category:Kickstarter-funded video games Category:Linux games Category:MacOS games Category:Nintendo Switch games Category:PlayStation 4 games Category:Point-and-click adventure games Category:Unity (game engine) games Category:Video games featuring female protagonists Category:Windows games
title: Jenny LeClue
